article.title: ExoMol molecular line lists XIX: high accuracy computed hot line lists for H$_2$$^{18}$O and H$_2$$^{17}$O

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main advantage of the novel method employed for constructing the Potential Energy Surface (PES) in this study?
choices: It allows for accurate prediction of only low-lying energy levels.
It eliminates the need for experimental energy level data.
It significantly extends the energy range for which accurate predictions can be made for H218O and H217O.
It relies solely on ab initio calculations, eliminating the need for empirical data.

multiple_choice_question.text: Refer to Table 1. Which potential energy surface (PES) demonstrates the best overall agreement with the observed J=0 term values for H217O?
choices: All three PESs exhibit equally good agreement with the observed values.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary goal of the procedure described for generating pseudo-experimental energy levels?
choices: To replace all calculated energy levels with experimentally observed ones.
To predict the energy levels of H216O based on H217O and H218O data.
To improve the accuracy of the line list by leveraging the extensive experimental data available for H216O to predict energy levels in H217O and H218O.
To validate the accuracy of the DVR3D program suite.

multiple_choice_question.text: Refer to Figure 1. What can be concluded about the distribution of H218O transitions in the HotWat78 line list?
choices: The majority of transitions occur at low J values.
The transitions are uniformly distributed across all J values.
The highest number of transitions occur for J values around 30.
No transitions occur for J values greater than 40.
